bioghist.p: Theodore Friend was president of Swarthmore College from 1973 to 1982. He is a teacher, historian, and novelist. His books include Indonesian Destinies (Harvard University Press, 2003) and Between Two Empires: The Ordeal of the Philippines (Yale University Press, 1965). He is president emeritus of the Eisenhower Fellowship and a senior fellow of the Foreign Policy Research Institute.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records from the office of President Theodore Friend. The collection consists primarily of topical files related to: faculty, staff, board members, and non-Swarthmore figures; minutes and correspondence related to the Board of Managers; campus and student activities and issues; facilities and college services, such as the health center; development, grants, and scholarship funds; political and governmental issues, such as divestment from South Africa, equal opportunity employment, and affirmative action policies; minutes and correspondence related to committeees such as the Council on Educational Policy and the Curriculum Committee; minutes of meetings of the "Three Colleges" from 1949 to 1972; staff meeting minutes; notes for a 1982 course on South East Asia; and photocopies of Friend's research notes on Japan, Indonesia, and the Philippines.
